fact_text: Holy Fire Flares Up Near Santiago Peak, 150 Acres Burned, 10 Percent Contained  Firefighters battled Tuesday a new flare-up from the nearly 23,000-acre Holy Fire that has been burning for three weeks . Devastating HOLY FIRE in Trabuco Canyon area injures 2 firefighters and burns more than 4000 acres. #HolyFire update: 4000 acres burned with 0% containment. It is moving quickly in all directions. Crews will continue to work through the night.
Prior to Monday’s apparent flare-up, the fire had burned an estimated 22,986 acres in Orange and Riverside counties, and it damaged or destroyed 24 structures, officials said.
